Detailed Description

template<int size, class T = double> template class RowVector

The class RowVector represents row vectors.

The class RowVector is derived from the base classes Matrix and VectorBase.

The class RowVector defines a data type RowVector and provides methods for operations such as cross product, dot product and element-by-element multiplication.

Example Program: See the example of the class ColumnVector.

T & operator() ( int elementPosition ) [inline]
 

This function overloads the () operator to access the element at the elementPosition position of the vector. The operator can be intuitively used to assign a value to an element in the vector such as 

myVector(2)=12.65;
Parameters:
elementPosition   The index of the element in the vector.
Returns:
The value of the element at the specified position.

T operator() ( int elementPosition ) const [inline]
 

This function overloads the () operator to read the element at the elementPosition position of the vector such as 

cout << myVector(2);
.
Parameters:
elementPosition   The index of the element in the vector.
Returns:
The value of the element at the specified position.

RowVector< size,T >& operator=<size, T> ( const VectorBase< T >& vectorBase ) [inline]
 

This function overloads the assignment operator to assign a VectorBase type to a RowVector type. Both objects must have the same dimensions.

Parameters:
vectorBase   The object of the base class VectorBase.

Reimplemented from VectorBase.

MatrixInitializer< T > operator=<T> ( const T & elementValue ) [virtual]
 

This function provides an overloaded assignment operator to initialize a vector object.

Parameters:
elementValue   The value to which all elements in the vector are initialized. The initialization of the vector object can also be done as a comma seperated list. For example: 
RowVector<3> myVector;
         myVector = 23.89, 88.98, 65.09;

Reimplemented from Matrix.
